. .. Notes

Actress presents a sweeping, poetic
summation of his tastes for DJ-Kicks. His
first commercially available mix-tape draws
a jagged freehand from the raw house of
Breaker 1 2 (Greg Beato) thru to Gherkin
Jerks (Larry Heard) via his own, exclusive
'Bird Matrix', and stacks of esoteric
connections between Autechre, Beneath, UR,
Shit & Shine and Mark Fell, to name but a
few. A tour de force of the last 25 years of
electronic dance music, it lays bare the far
flung coordinates of Actress' deeply skewed
sound, whether jamming the coarse textures
of Breaker 1 2 against the graceful lines of
Lorenzo Senni, ramping Beneath's sluggish
swagger to a tetchy +8 or veering from
Snakepiss's opitaed arabesque, 'Toil', into
the recursive psychedelia of Shit & Shine
and the tail-feathered swing of Chez N
Trent's 'Windy City Club' evergreen. We'd
imagine that some heads are flipped both
ways - the trad house types may struggle
with his oblique mixing technique, whilst
the reel freaks will be wowed by his "give a
f**k?" attitude. Like Powell, Mumdance or
Bill Kouligas, this fella is a major
catalyst behind rewiring our perceptions of
what's possible, what is "allowed" in modern
dance/electronic music, and this mix is a
sterling case in point.
